title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson

highlights.representative_text: It's what the philosopher Alan Watts used to refer to as "the backwards law"--the idea that the more you pursue feeling better all the time, the less satisfied you become, as pursuing something only reinforces the fact that you lack it in the first place.
highlights.selected_text: pursuing something only reinforces the fact that you lack it in the first place.

highlights.representative_text: This book will not teach you how to gain or achieve, but rather how to lose and let go.
highlights.selected_text: lose and let go

highlights.representative_text: Our problems birth our happiness, along with slightly better, slightly upgraded problems.
highlights.selected_text: Our problems birth our happiness, along with slightly better, slightly upgraded problems

highlights.representative_text: Ever notice that sometimes when you care less about something, you do better at it? Notice how it's often the person who is the least invested in the success of something that actually ends up achieving it? Notice how sometimes when you stop giving a fuck, everything seems to fall into place?
highlights.selected_text: Ever notice that sometimes when you care less about something, you do better at it? Notice how it's often the person who is the least invested in the success of something that actually ends up achieving it? Notice how sometimes when you stop giving a fuck, everything seems to fall into place?

highlights.representative_text: If we have problems that are unsolvable, our unconscious figures that we're either uniquely special or uniquely defective in some way.
highlights.selected_text: If we have problems that are unsolvable, our unconscious figures that we're either uniquely special or uniquely defective in some way.

highlights.representative_text: Problems never stop; they merely get exchanged and/or upgraded.
highlights.selected_text: Problems never stop; they merely get exchanged and/or upgraded.

highlights.representative_text: The fact is, people who base their self-worth on being right about everything prevent themselves from learning from their mistakes.
highlights.selected_text: The fact is, people who base their self-worth on being right about everything prevent themselves from learning from their mistakes

highlights.representative_text: It's far more helpful to assume that you're ignorant and don't know a whole lot. This keeps you unattached to superstitious or poorly informed beliefs and promotes a constant state of learning and growth.
highlights.selected_text: It's far more helpful to assume that you're ignorant and don't know a whole lot. This keeps you unattached to superstitious or poorly informed beliefs and promotes a constant state of learning and growth.

highlights.representative_text: The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience. And, paradoxically, the acceptance of one's negative experience is itself a positive experience.
highlights.selected_text: The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience. And, paradoxically, the acceptance of one's negative experience is itself a positive experience.

highlights.representative_text: The deeper the pain, the more helpless we feel against our problems, and the more entitlement we adopt to compensate for those problems.
highlights.selected_text: The deeper the pain, the more helpless we feel against our problems, and the more entitlement we adopt to compensate for those problems

highlights.representative_text: So I'll give you a minute to unpretzel your brain and maybe read that again: Wanting positive experience is a negative experience; accepting negative experience is a positive experience.
highlights.selected_text: Wanting positive experience is a negative experience; accepting negative experience is a positive experience

highlights.representative_text: The problem with people who hand out fucks like ice cream at a goddamn summer camp is that they don't have anything more fuck-worthy to dedicate their fucks to.
highlights.selected_text: The problem with people who hand out fucks like ice cream at a goddamn summer camp is that they don't have anything more fuck-worthy to dedicate their fucks to.

highlights.representative_text: No matter where you go, there's a five-hundred-pound load of shit waiting for you. And that's perfectly fine. The point isn't to get away from the shit. The point is to find the shit you enjoy dealing with.
highlights.selected_text: No matter where you go, there's a five-hundred-pound load of shit waiting for you. And that's perfectly fine. The point isn't to get away from the shit. The point is to find the shit you enjoy dealing with

highlights.representative_text: "The solution to one problem is merely the creation of the next one."
highlights.selected_text: The solution to one problem is merely the creation of the next one

highlights.representative_text: I once heard an artist say that when a person has no problems, the mind automatically finds a way to invent some.
highlights.selected_text: I once heard an artist say that when a person has no problems, the mind automatically finds a way to invent some

highlights.representative_text: We suffer for the simple reason that suffering is biologically useful. It is nature's preferred agent for inspiring change.
highlights.selected_text: We suffer for the simple reason that suffering is biologically useful. It is nature's preferred agent for inspiring change

highlights.representative_text: You can't be an important and life-changing presence for some people without also being a joke and an embarrassment to others. You just can't.
highlights.selected_text: You can't be an important and life-changing presence for some people without also being a joke and an embarrassment to others. You just can't.

highlights.representative_text: It then follows that finding something important and meaningful in your life is perhaps the most productive use of your time and energy. Because if you don't find that meaningful something, your fucks will be given to meaningless and frivolous causes.
highlights.selected_text: It then follows that finding something important and meaningful in your life is perhaps the most productive use of your time and energy. Because if you don't find that meaningful something, your fucks will be given to meaningless and frivolous causes.

highlights.representative_text: What is the pain that you want to sustain?
highlights.selected_text: What is the pain that you want to sustain?

highlights.representative_text: I think what most people--especially educated, pampered middle-class white people--consider "life problems" are really just side effects of not having anything more important to worry about.
highlights.selected_text: I think what most people--especially educated, pampered middle-class white people--consider "life problems" are really just side effects of not having anything more important to worry about.

highlights.representative_text: Ironically, this fixation on the positive--on what's better, what's superior--only serves to remind us over and over again of what we are not, of what we lack, of what we should have been but failed to be.
highlights.selected_text: Ironically, this fixation on the positive--on what's better, what's superior--only serves to remind us over and over again of what we are not, of what we lack, of what we should have been but failed to be

highlights.representative_text: They lack the ability to take on new perspectives and empathize with others.
highlights.selected_text: take on new perspectives and empathize with others

highlights.representative_text: Everything comes with an inherent sacrifice--whatever makes us feel good will also inevitably make us feel bad.
highlights.selected_text: whatever makes us feel good will also inevitably make us feel bad

highlights.representative_text: One of those realizations was this: that life itself is a form of suffering. The rich suffer because of their riches. The poor suffer because of their poverty. People without a family suffer because they have no family. People with a family suffer because of their family. People who pursue worldly pleasures suffer because of their worldly pleasures. People who abstain from worldly pleasures suffer because of their abstention.
highlights.selected_text: One of those realizations was this: that life itself is a form of suffering. The rich suffer because of their riches. The poor suffer because of their poverty. People without a family suffer because they have no family. People with a family suffer because of their family. People who pursue worldly pleasures suffer because of their worldly pleasures. People who abstain from worldly pleasures suffer because of their abstention.

underlines.representative_text: The guy was always rolling, always on, and if you gave him an inch of conversational daylight, he’d pulverize you about how world-spinning his work was, how brilliant his latest ideas were, and he’d name-drop so much it felt like you were talking to a tabloid reporter.
Record contracts didn’t exactly fall out of the sky, especially for raucous, upstart metal bands.
underlines.note: someone who has suddenly gained popularity

underlines.representative_text: And because we are apes, we instinctually measure ourselves against others and vie for status.
Having found nothing, he seems flustered.
He was shuttled around from talk show to radio station; politicians clamored to shake his hand; he published a book and was even offered a large sum of money by the government.
Very few animals on earth have the ability to think cogent thoughts to begin with, but we humans have the luxury of being able to have thoughts about our thoughts.
Kids were given inane homework assignments, like writing down all the reasons why they thought they were special, or the five things they liked most about themselves.

Each is loaded with its own silly teen desiderata—colored pens, old notes passed in class, early-nineties CDs with cracked cases, dried-up markers, an old sketchpad with half its pages missing, dust and lint and crap accumulated during a maddeningly circuitous middle school existence.
My family stonewalls the way Warren Buffett makes money or Jenna Jameson fucks: we’re champions at it.
underlines.note: when someone asks a questions u evade(stonewall) without giving the answer

underlines.representative_text: He spreads my stuff out, separating each item and coagulating them into little piles beside my gym gear.
Then he’d tell the homeowner to have a nice day and saunter on down to the next house.

Jimmy did make some money, although it was usually through the sketchiest of means, like selling another person’s business idea as his own, or finagling a loan from someone, or worse, talking someone into giving him equity in their start-up.
underlines.note: finesse. obtain something by devious means
believe that we deserve special treatment
